Lab 0: Setup

This first assignment is simple but essential. It's not graded, but is required for you to participate in the course.

Part 1: Team Formation (5 minutes)

Visit Canvas and click Team Formation link on the left side. Answer its questions by midnight EDT tonight (Instructions). It should take you less than five minutes.

This form provides us with the information we need to:

  • give you access to our class website (including Lab 0!)
  • to form learning groups (project teams),
  • to learn more about your background, and
  • to help support you through the term.

I will be adding everyone to our class website on GitHub in the early afternoon following our first class.

Part 2: Slack (2 minutes)

Complete this step before the next class meeting.

Join our Slack Workspace via the link on the front page of our Canvas sites.

You'll automatically be added to several COSC 50 slack channels within our workspace. All official course communications will come through Slack and Canvas.

Note

Do not send the teaching team email! All communications must be via Slack

Part 3: Systems (20 minutes)

Complete this step before the next class meeting.

Read through the Systems page. Most of you use MacOS or Windows -- not Linux -- but in this course we will program exclusively on Linux. For consistency, we will all use a Linux server managed by our colleagues in the Thayer School of Engineering. This machine is known as plink.thayer.dartmouth.edu. Follow the instructions in this GitHub repository to get yourself ready.
